so my top 3 tips for learning a language
I make sure that you're doing something
active and passive in the language that
means that you could be actively
learning the grammar actively practicing
your pronunciation and then passively
you can maybe watch a film in the
evening with subtitles in English
listening to music while you are having
your breakfast and it's really important
as well to surround yourself and to do
everything as much as you can in the
language in the new language you're
learning so make sure you're surrounded
by the language at all times while
you're working if possible while you're
jogging going to the gym there are so
many ways nowadays that we can do this
and really important is to make sure
you're learning wherever and whenever
you can thanks to modern technology you
don't have to be spending hours reading
a book you can get your app out and
learn with an application for learning a
language so even if something for 10 to
15 minutes a day or in the morning and
then later in the evening
you've really covered so much in so
little time
